org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol

Class HdfsBlocksMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.protocol.HdfsBlocksMetadata

  • @InterfaceAudience.Private
@InterfaceStability.Unstable
public class HdfsBlocksMetadata
extends Object
    Augments an array of blocks on a datanode with additional information about where the block is stored.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long[] blockIds
      List of blocks
      private String blockPoolId
      The block pool that was queried
      private List<byte[]> volumeIds
      List of volumes
      private List<Integer> volumeIndexes
      List of indexes into volumeIds, one per block in blocks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs HdfsBlocksMetadata.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long[] getBlockIds()
      Get the array of blocks.
      List<byte[]> getVolumeIds()
      Get the list of volume identifiers in raw byte form.
      List<Integer> getVolumeIndexes()
      Get a list of indexes into the array of VolumeIds, one per block.

    • Field Detail

      • blockPoolId

        private final String blockPoolId
        The block pool that was queried

      • blockIds

        private final long[] blockIds
        List of blocks

      • volumeIds

        private final List<byte[]> volumeIds
        List of volumes

      • volumeIndexes

        private final List<Integer> volumeIndexes
        List of indexes into volumeIds, one per block in blocks. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE indicates that the block was not found.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HdfsBlocksMetadata

        public HdfsBlocksMetadata(String blockPoolId,
                  long[] blockIds,
                  List<byte[]> volumeIds,
                  List<Integer> volumeIndexes)
        Constructs HdfsBlocksMetadata.
        Parameters:
        blockIds - List of blocks described
        volumeIds - List of potential volume identifiers, specifying volumes where blocks may be stored
        volumeIndexes - Indexes into the list of volume identifiers, one per block
